result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L Flick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Confiscated firearm to be destroyed.

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Kevin L Flick in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has no additions or corrections to PSI, no Chapter 950 requirement.
Defense had no additions or corrections to PSI. 

BTC:  ct 1 - 3 years WPS (1 year IC & 2 years ES)
No alcohol or C/S unless prescribed by physician, random UA's and breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment and aftercare or any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment or employment/school
IMPOSED AND STAYED for 3 years probation
same conditions

ct 2 - WPS 3 years (1 year IC & 2 years ES) IMPOSED AND STAYED
same conditions, 
Probation for 3 years, same conditions, concurrent to ct 1 but if revoked, consecutive.
Eligible for CIP and SAT
DNA sample
3 months RCJ - huber for employment, report-in date 10-1-16.
Firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA surcharge
45 days credit for time served but not for probation, but if revoked.
